oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Myth-busting strategies for ovine progressive pneumonia virus (OPPv) control
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wolfe, Cindy
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sheep
ovine
ovine progressive pneumonia
OPPv
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper reviews the latest information on the spread and control of ovine progressive pneumonia virus (OPPv). Infected adult animals serve as the reservoir for the virus, and the virus is spread to genetically susceptible animals through respiratory secretions. It is now known that transmission of the virus through the colostrum and milk is not a significant risk factor. Control programs consist of segregating testnegative animals from those testing positive, and selecting replacement animals that have protective genotypes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2017; 128-130
